intro: Erigeron hyrcanicus, commonly known as the Hyrcanian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in its native habitat.
